dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S736 RS: Alaska Subsistence Structure Protection Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Murkowski introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
Reported by Mr. Wyden, with amendments and an amendment to the title
action.action-instruction: Omit the part struck through and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To establish a maximum amount for special use permit fees applicable to certain cabins on National Forest System land in the State of Alaska.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Alaska Subsistence Structure Protection Act of 2013 .

paragraph.text: The term covered cabin means a cabin (including related structures) on National Forest System land in the State of Alaska—
The term covered cabin or temporary structure means a cabin (including related structures) or a tent platform on National Forest System land in the State of Alaska—

subparagraph.text: that is used for subsistence uses;
that is subject to section 1316(a) of the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 3204(a) ); or
that is used for commercial fishing by a permittee that does not generate more than $15,000 in gross annual income from the fishery.

paragraph.text:
The term subsistence uses has the meaning given the term in section 803 of the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act ( 16 U.S.C. 3113
).

section.header: Alaska subsistence use cabin permit fees
section.text: The maximum amount of the fee for the issuance of a special use permit by the Secretary of Agriculture for the use and occupancy of National Forest System land for a covered cabin shall be not more than $250.

section.header: Alaska subsistence use cabin and temporary structure special use land use fees
section.text: The maximum land use fee for a special use permit issued by the Secretary of Agriculture for the use and occupancy of National Forest System land for a covered cabin or temporary structure shall be not more than $250.

bill.official-title-amendment: Amend the title so as to read: A bill to establish a maximum amount for special use land use fees applicable to certain cabins and temporary structures on National Forest System land in the State of Alaska..

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with amendments and an amendment to the title
